title.narrative: IDPs Shelter and Non-food Item Support Project

description.narrative:
There were recent conflicts around Jur River and Bahr el Ghazal; a dozen reported deaths resulted in displacement of over 20,000 people (otherwise known as an Internally Displaced Person - IDP) to surrounding market centers. World Concern carried out an assessment in three of these newly populated centers.The lack of adequate support to the IDPs has forced many to walk to other towns or centers. While food and shelter are serious needs for these new IDPs, they have not received support for WASH, health, nutrition or protection needs. If they leave the region, it is likely to create a vacuum where rebels may operate and further affect access to the region and the quick return of the villagers to their communities. Support for non-food items (NFIs) and shelter at these sites would not only provide needed relief, it would also help contain the insecurity from spreading further since the rebels are also not keen on attacking the civilians in the region.
World Concern will distribute cooking sets, fleece blankets, sleeping mats, mosquito nets, jerricans, plastic sacks and ponchos to 750 displaced households and 200 vulnerable host community households. Additionally, World Concern will provide shelter materials—bamboo poles, plastic sheeting, rubber rope and pegs—to create 4447 shelters.
